summary: This document consists of three consecutive shift logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on July 7, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell. The logs detail routine prison operations, counts, and notably record Epstein being removed from his cell to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at 7:20 PM. The document is significant as it provides the official institutional timeline on the day of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as inmate #76318-054. The log records him being removed from his cell to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at 7:20 PM on July 7, 2019.

persons.name: Williams
persons.context: A self-surrender inmate (#76319-054) who arrived at the facility at 3:21 AM, increasing the total inmate count.

events.title: Epstein Moved to Special Housing Unit
events.description: At 7:20 PM, inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was removed from his cell and moved to the Special Housing Unit (SHU), as recorded in the Evening Watch log.

events.title: Inmate Self-Surrender
events.description: At 3:21 AM, an inmate named Williams (#76319-054) arrived as a self-surrender, increasing the facility's total inmate count.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
Local Hospital (referenced as location of an inmate with USMS guards)
keyFacts: The logs cover three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch) on Sunday, July 7, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Jeffrey Epstein (Inmate #76318-054) is recorded as being removed from his cell to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at 7:20 PM during the Evening Watch.
One inmate was recorded as being at a local hospital under the guard of the U.S. Marshals Service (USMS) throughout all three shifts.
The logs show routine prison operations, including multiple inmate counts, equipment checks, and body alarm tests.
The ending inmate count for the facility was 790, with 76 inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the conclusion of the Evening Watch.
